name: places/ChIJeVcyorhZwokRlzPu8DrVOas
adrFormatAddress: 130 10th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text:
Guy who was supposed to be on salad bar was CUTTING RAW CHICKEN !!! I asked for a salad… he walked around the corner with the same raw chicken gloves opened the fridge to where they had the prepared greens for salad and grabbed it out the fridge before he opened my salad I told him to change HIS GLOVES.. he was going to use those same gloves to make my chicken and god knows what else. Chicken is prepared by a wall where paint is peeling. No one should be preparing RAW meats and then touching greens or salads for customers or any food period. I paid for my $14 salad but threw it about just thinking about how the back counter looked and not knowing if I would be sick or not. I know the other employees behind the counter heard me tell him to change his gloves too. Seeing raw chicken just out in the open by that dirty paint chipped wall.. and then him trying to use those same gloves to prepare cold foods is unsettling. Health department needs to show up during times like this.
Deli is overpriced any way and much better options in neighborhood.

originalText.text: They’re always running out of ingredients, avocado is a vital ingredient to have! Overpriced af for this. It’s not even a stuffed wrapped. It’s lacking so much. . $13 for this is not worth it! The staff at this deli is rude! You have a way better chance walking up to 22nd to Galleria then this deli. Don’t waste your money here!

originalText.text: Hello, I recently passed by the deli and it reminded me of an incident from 1.5 years ago. My pregnant wife slipped and fell while we were crossing the street adjacent to the deli. It was really cold outdoors, and she hurt, leading to concern for her and the baby. Despite the store being relatively empty, we didn't feel welcomed while were in store and feel the bother the person working there. At the end we buy water and a juice. It was a difficult experience for us

originalText.text:
Undeniably “mid” — the unfortunate thing is there are just very few delis in the area for other options.

This turkey sandwich was over $10 with tax and was as dry a British humor, even with chipotle mayo on it. The hero roll was vaguely stale and the tomatoes definitely leaned towards the mealy side. Maybe they make decent B.E.Cs but for lunch, I’d save your money.

originalText.text: I walked in to get something to drink and saw that they were charging $1.99 for a single Twinkie.  Not a two pack but a single Twinkie.  That stopped me dead in my tracks and I believe I threw up in my mouth a little bit.  I turned right around and walked out.  You see it's these price gouging practices that drive me crazy.  What sane person would give a business that is clearly ripping people off their money?  I don't know but it's not going to be me.  I say enough with these price gouging places that try to justify these practices as doing business in the city.  It's immoral and it is wrong.  I cannot speak for anyone but myself but I can take my business elsewhere.  I encourage others to do the same.
